FuncDef: This command enables the generation of a default route and its LSA type (3 or 7) into a Not So Stubby Area (NSSA) by an NSSA Area Border Router (ABR).

ParaDef.Info: Specifies a type 7 LSA should be used for the default route in the config>router>ospf>area>nssa context. ParamDefault: Default- Type 3 LSA default route.
Specifies an NSSA-LSA type should be used for the default route in the config>router>ospf3>area>nssa context.

Specifies whether or not adjacency checks are performed before originating a default route. If this parameter is configured, then no area 0 adjacency is required for the ABR to advertise the default route. ParamDefault: Default- Adjacency checks are performed, and an area 0 adjacency is required for the ABR to advertise the default route.
